ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] *Sigh*
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, this is freakin annoying.  There s evidently a limit on the size of messages posted here, but they don t tell you that, and then don t post the message
ygData.messageBody:
Well, this is freakin' annoying. There's evidently a limit on the
size of messages posted here, but they don't tell you that, and then
don't post the message if it's too large. This is my third try to
post this, so let me break it up. Heaven forbid we ask people to
read too much at once, hey?

OK, let's see what we can do here. First thing, if you haven't
already, you should visit the official EQ Tech Support page: go to
http://eqlive.station.sony.com, click on Technical Help on the left.

First, your processor. A Pentium II 200 MHz will not cut it, so that
would be the basic problem. Your RAM should come in 64 or 32 MB
increments, so you probably have 128, 192, or 256 MB. You could have
224, but that would be an odd amount; if it's cobbled together using
different kinds of RAM, that could also be a problem (but not one
that would prevent you from running EQ).

At 256 MB of RAM, if you're running the Luclin expansion, you will
only be able to use about half the new models.

Win NT and Linux are different operating systems - you probably have
Windows 95, 98, or XP. I hope you have Windows 98, because Windows
95 does not support DirectX 8.1, which you need to run the new
graphics engine. That could be your basic problem, either that or
the processor.

Required specs, from the Official Sony page:

Windows┬« 98/2000/ME/XP <---- Need to check this.
Pentium┬« II 400Mhz or greater <----------------
256 MB RAM
16 MB Direct3D compliant video card <--- Your card is fine.
DirectX 8.0 compatible sound card <------ ??
28.8k (or faster) Internet connection
4X speed CD-ROM
450 MB+ hard drive space <---- HD is OK, unless you've already
filled it with stuff.

Note: Although technically below the minimum specs, players with 128
MB of RAM will still be able to run Luclin by turning off the new
character models.

Recommended Specs:

Windows┬« 98/2000/ME/XP
Pentium┬« III or greater
512 MB RAM
32 MB Direct3D compliant video card and hardware T&L (i.e. ATI Radeon
or Nvidia GeForce 2 or greater)
DirectX 8.0 compatible sound card
56.6k (or faster) Internet connection
16X speed CD-ROM
1.5 GB+ hard drive space

Note: DirectX 8.1 or greater is required for Windows 98 ,XP, ME, and
2k.

See next section.
